content.label:
I love the app but no sound on iPad mini 4, iOS 13.1
Game 5 stars
Sound 1 Star

title.label: Game is good but could be lots better for VI/totally blind people

content.label:
Hello,
I’m playing this with the default settings, the normal setting for difficulty and the short and long games. Of course, I’ve done one of each. However, I don’t know how to put new people in my klan ring, for as I try, the original people appear to be there. There was a person on YouTube who did this easily, but I cannot for some reason. This othere person was also visually impaired, as I am and used his vision whereas I use VoiceOver from Apple. I also can’t see how to safely complete one of the hero quests and remember all that happened in the myth at the same time. Good game, though/worth its money if a little frustrating at times.
Ashleigh Piccinino
P.S. I’ve noticed some very strange things happening with the game. If too many things are open, the game can crash/have to reopen the game. Plus, it’s hard for me to constantly scroll through all the options as I’m using the VoiceOver system on my iPhone to do so. I think this game needs major improvements as far as being more accessable with VoiceOver. The map doesn’t work hardly at all, saying “unknown hex” or “explored hex.” What does that mean? And why doesn’t VoiceOver speak the plaes on the map—it does but very rarely. I need to know where I’m sending my people to, in cardinal diretions, you know. Also, if you need to read an entire manual to play a game, it’s not a game at all...I don’t think. Why can’t the manual be in a few brf files you can save on your computer and read with a Braille display? That way, you have something to refer to without having to go bak into the menu, back into the manual, and back into what you’re happening to have trouble with. Not worth the ten dollars, in my opinion until these things get fixed.
Lots of screens, lots of choices to make, but it all feels random and outside of any logic. Boring from the get go and didn’t improve.

I’m a huge strategy gamer, playing crusader kings 2 on my PC. This game is like the mobile version with its depth. It’s actually a port of the PC game. But oddly I liked the mobile version more than the PC one. That’s strange but nonetheless this game is a must have for any serious strategy gamer. You will not be disappointed.

Just recently bought Six Ages and have been playing it for the last few days. Not sure if that has anything to do with the problem I’m experiencing but I’ve picked King of Dragon Pass back up and it will not let me view tribes in my relations screen or access it via the map screen. When I do try to view tribes it crashes the whole game and takes me back to my phones home screen. I’m at loss... it never did this before. Could it be an iOS update that messed it up? Please get back to me concerning this as I would appreciate it, immensely. Really enjoyed playing KoDP. Was a five star game, current problem withheld

UPDATE: Thank you so much for correcting the issues and in such a timely manner, developers. You’re appreciated greatly!
I really hope seeing how I paid for the game just to finally finish the making the clan u guys won’t just forget about us n will update
Very fun game. Still haven’t beat t although I have tried many times. Great replayability.

This iOS version has become the de facto version of the unparalleled open-ended narrative-based culture builder from 20 years ago. Great implementation. Let's hope some newer games finally go in the KoDP direction since it's gotten so much more visibility thanks to iOS.
Great entertainment. Wish it had iPhone X support. Best money spent in the App Store.
I’ve play this game NUMEROUS times each with a different play style. The variety of what you wanna do with your clan is limitless.
I enjoy how every game I play has new outcomes. Really a great story.
Unique game with a great storyline and freedom to explore. Thank you developers for your great work!

There was clearly a massive amount of work put into developing the lore for this game. And once you know it, it is extremely immersive. 

However, that is the drawback. You have to commit a couple hours to reading the manual and lore to know what you are doing. You cannot play this game blind and have any chance of winning. The advice from the advisors is useless since between them they will recommend every option.  

Don't get me wrong, I throughly enjoyed the game, but it was a lot of work getting ready to play. I never really enjoyed the hero quests though since it felt like trial and error to figure out the right choices, and once you did, you could do them over and over again easily.

Update: 2017 and this is still without question the best entertainment app in the store. I will have an iDevice as long as it is. I'm amazed they even released more content. This game has so much replay ability. Get it, now!

I am so happy to have found this game. I am incredibly surprised by the depth and can't put it down. I wish there were more games on this level of awesomeness for the busy minded.

P.S. Don't listen to the derp who claims it's not worth the money because he only played through it 4 or 5 times. A play through can easily take you 30+ hours. A good play though much, MUCH longer.

I loved this game last year, but I discovered it because it was highly praised for its accessibility with voiceover, and it seems they've abandoned that community. I was very excited to pick it up again recently, and some values simply cannot be modified, some screens trap you and require restart, and in many, you can no longer flick to navigate without being thrown around the screen at random.

This game is a fantastic adventure for everyone. The story is written so exquisite and the art is both Tantalizing and colorful. This game is both long and endless. And eventually it ended and I was sad, I was attached to my clan. I won but I lost a part of me that I could never get back.

This game is the best I've ever played and would gladly pay 5, 10, and even 15 dollars for a sequel.

title.label: Literally the best app on my phone

content.label: This has been and is probably the best game in the app store. The depth of storytelling is rivaled only by its incredible artwork and limitless replay value. First became king on my computer over 10 years ago, now I get to play where ever this is the greatest game.

title.label: My favorite game of all time!

content.label: This game is so amazing. It is the perfect management game and the storylines presented are vast and enjoyable to read. I cannot wait till the developers finish Six Ages this year ; it is by far my most anticipated game coming out in 2016. KODP is worth every penny and the replay value is through the roof!

title.label: Basically the best game I've ever played.

content.label: I cannot express how much I love this game. It's extremely in depth and the replay value is amazing. I don't think it's actually $10 I think you'll be charged much less, but either way it's worth it. It's a large (100mb) file, but you can play it offline. There are no ads, and absolutely no disappointments. It's a better layout on an IPad, but the game is the same on my phone. I run two games very different from each other on my two devices. Great game for getting a 12+ kid interested in reading. Has the feel of a fantasy book like dragon lance novels, with the control of civilization. It is choose your own adventure style, but unlike other games that basically end up the same no matter what you decide, this game has tons of different paths to victory and defeat. Mad props to the creator of this game. I pray for the gods to bless them and for them to be inspired to add more or create a second sage or prequel.

title.label: I like the game, but issues

content.label:
I want to rate 5 stars but I can't. Depth of gameplay is fantastic and the game itself is very, almost surprisingly fun. That all being said, when you advertise your game as fully playable with VoiceOver, I expect that to be true. The map is frustrating at best, navigation order on several screens leaves much to be desired, we need a more precise way to adjust numerical values and in several cases, vital text is missing, leaving you to make a choice with no information.. This last can be disastrous, and comes up most often during quests.
With a little work a 5 star app easily, but right now, I feel 3 is more than generous.

title.label: Probably the game with the greatest depth on iOS

content.label: Just wonderful. Truly amazing gameplay depth rivaling the Witcher 3 and Skyrim. Don't let the basic screenshots deceive you, his is one game providing an unrivaled experience on iOS.

title.label: A steep price, but worth it

content.label:
I saw this ~4 year old game and was like $10! This will be the most expensive app on my phone!

The thing is, I love dragons and managing civilizations. So I bought it. 

Social aspects of life are showcased in kodp's wonderful random events and the common tech trees are replaced with sacrifices and heroquests for the gods. All the magic is a nice change of pace from civilization games. 

Of course, not all sacrifices produce results (sometimes even large ones). The randomness keeps the game fresh each playthrough but can be punishing at times. 

The game is text based, so if reading isn't your thing then this isn't for you.

Highly entertaining, endless replay value, fresh take on civilization management with focus on relationships instead of conquest (conquest isn't really an option), lots of backstory to read. Great at demonstrating consequences of your actions. 5/5
It is amazing

title.label: Part strategy part rpg with great lore

content.label:
Plus an awesome time period. Overall incredible game. Definitely the best I've ever played on iOS.

Also, incredibly stable and lightweight! No crashes at all, and no loading times. A+

title.label: Addictive and Well designed Story/Play - Has Potential for Greatness and Overpriced

content.label: Worth $5 max. $10 that I paid I should've received a bundle with two expansions (which would make this game hit its potential along with good updates).   Addictive and Well designed Story/Play - Has Potential for Greatness and Overpriced

title.label: Rivals the Depth and Lore of Skyrim. Incredible.

content.label: So no everyone is going to agree on the title, that's fine. This game lets you dive into a Nordic culture where the spirits, gods and sacrifices make a profound difference in the life of your kinsmen. This game has 600+ frames of artwork and hundreds upon hundreds of unique events. Decisions that happen two years ago may bring prosperity or run. One of the more fascinating aspects is the hero questing, where a leader travels to the lands of the gods and pays homage. This event is the highlight of the year for your tribe and can bring great blessing or your leader can come home in pieces. It also makes you wonder about your ethics if you were a tribal leader. Raid and pillage your neighbor every fall? Clearly... They came to your clan hall and dropped a duce in front of your throne (true story). Moreover, it's a world that not clearly understood by any of the characters, leading to the mystery. Enjoy the music and some of the most complex gameplay you'll find in the App Store. The learning curve is there but worth the investment.

If you love homework and don't have anything better to do you might like this.  But in my opinion if you really wanted to work and study you're better off getting a second job or going to school as this would actually help your life and probably be more fun.

I try games before i buy. This one passed woth flying colors so i am paying the devs homage by buying it.
You guys rock.

title.label: Best text based game I've ever played

content.label: If your looking for a game with a proper story and true immersive gameplay, then download this game. You will spend countless hours diving into the lore of the game and creating a story truly made by your actions. Unlike other games that say your choice influences the outcome of the game but barely does this one truly truly does. Also the game can go from extremely serious (being raided by chaos monsters who can lay waste to your most elite men) to light hearted humor (meeting duck warriors who want their stolen eggs back lol). Overall, in my opinion, this is the best app game out there.
Just a Completely amazing game, just what I was looking for. Definitely recommend. Also if you get the game read the Manuel it brings and look at some guides online.

This is possibly he best game on the App Store. Old school. Beautiful graphics. Good music. Challenging and thought provoking gameplay. Well-thought-out fantasy world. And, of course, an angry warrior duck that killed my best fighter 😂😂 10/10 would play again

This is an amazing, sit back and relax game that you can take your time and truly invest in. The lore is incredibly deep, which makes it easier to just become a part of the amazing world created by these incredible developers. Read the description and know what you're getting yourself into before you post unjustified complaints about KODP. If you find this while it's still on sale, don't hesitate. $5 is a steal for this game, and I can really say I'm excited to hear that a second game is in the making.
The continued support for this exceptional title represents the paragon of iOS development. These are the apps and devs we should support.

This game introduced me to the fantastic world of Glorantha. You take control of a clan that's part of an of Anglo-Saxon inspired folk known as the Storm Tribe. Gods and spirits have a great impact on daily life in Dragonpass, and you'll find yourself sacrificing silver, cattle, maybe even thrills to keep them happy. Many common fantasy races are present as allies or adversaries, but with a unique twist. Take the nomadic riders of Prax, who are forbidden from riding horses so they ride fantastic beasts such as antelope, rhinos, elephants, etc. Elves exist as xenophobic plant-men. Dwarves have a culture and society that is highly foreign to humanity. True dragons have the power of gods. Dragon-folk exist as the Dragonewts, creatures that evolve into more advanced forms, eventually becoming dragons over the eons, and reincarnate into new bodies as they die. Trolls are a race gifted with immortality and great strength, but cursed with infertility. This setting has such a rich and intriguing lore, it is well worth the time and monetary investment.

title.label: Still Going Strong! Can’t Wait for Six Ages ;)

content.label:
Updating the Review to say that KoDP is still the 5 star game I bought nearly 4 years ago. 

Do yourself a favor. Grab a hot tea, cup of joe or whatever you fancy. Find a nice quiet, but ambient place to relax and play/read this game.

Previous review:

I've had this game since 12/11 and to this day it never gets old. The game is so heavy in content that there are areas I have yet to explore. Highly recommend for those who enjoy the choose your adventure meets RPG elements wrapped up into one game and then some.

I have replayed it over and over.  It takes a little bit to figure out the mechanics, but once you do, it'll be hard to pull you away from it. Beautiful art, brilliant dialogue, and like I mentioned, load's of replayability. I was wondering why they hadn't updated it in so long, and yesterday they did. Thank you for making such a masterpiece.
If you love epic storytelling and strategy , you'll love this extraordinarily good, unique and unusually well-crafted game
Wonderful and addicting game but since I got the new iPhone 6s Plus it constantly crashes for different reasons. Makes the game unplayable

title.label: Exactly what you're hoping it is.

content.label: This game is about increasing the number of cows your tribe has, build an empire without cows...? I don't think so.

name.label: Name taken so I use this

title.label: i remember griffon mountain campaign book as a starting place for games i ran

content.label:
on those fond memories alone i'll buy this sight unseen.
whatever happened to chaosium? 
did they just decide enough was enough?
well they did a good job with glorantha, and whatever they did after that i hope they are doing well.
their creative spirit earned them a special place in my heart.
am i gushing?
well it's a small place for comments, so intensity counts.
there were some great conversations with spirits bound into equipment.
This is one of my all time favorite games. I greatly appreciate all the changes, fixes, and new content! Thanks so much for the iOS port!

I play this game on my iPhone 5s using voice over. The game is a lot of fun even if it feels a little random at times. By random I mean it's a little hard to play strategically when potential outcomes for any decision made are completely unpredictable at times. There is a lot to do in the game. Tons of hours of gameplay. Hi replay value as there's so many scenarios you want to revisit. Highly recommended for old-school PC RPG fans as well as blind or low vision users as voice over works well. Sort of feels like civilization meets dungeons and dragons. Voiceover could still use a little improvement. For example when adjusting the slider for resources you can't get The exact number of resources you want to allocate.
This  is a great game but I think that its a little annoying that there is no lumber to cut down or smiths to make the swords sure there is the crafters but you have no say what they make

... if it's your cup of tea. A text-based choose your own adventure storybook with deep strategic elements under the surface.

No in game ads seen.

If you like reading dark ages fantasy you will really really like this game. If you're not into that, or are unsure, maybe watch some gameplay video before purchasing.

title.label: Best game on the App Store

content.label: I take reviews very seriously but with this game.....I have no words............

title.label: Best game on the App Store

content.label: I take reviews very seriously but with this game.....I have no words............

This app is by far the greatest game on the App Store. I consistently buy games and I've never played a game to where I screenshotted the ending and look back on it every now and then to remind me how awesome it was. If this game charged $20.00, I'd still buy it. The decisions, the game mechanics, the quests, everything. Game was just great.

This game is as realistic as the game's situation can get. For example, let's say for the sake of example you raid and fail so you go back in time, you might send stronger forces, but things might be different and if they are the same, the outcome might be different. What I'm saying is that you never completely have control, so maybe if you restart the year, half the things happened before might never happen the second time.

title.label: A Must-Have for Any RPG Buff

content.label: I have spent over 70 hours playing this games, and every hour was filled with enjoyment and intrigue. King of Dragon Pass is well worth the money, even with it's steep learning curve and difficulty level. Not for the easily discouraged, but most definitely one of the best games in the App Store.

The scenarios are intriguing at first, but soon you learn the best combos and the fun goes out of it. A lot of it is just tapping choices on a dialogue box; maybe I'm missing something, but the other tactical choices like warrior numbers or council members only seem to have a negligible impact. I found it impossible to maintain decent morale and riches in my tribe and just gave up after a while.
